subject: Leadership
title: Servant Leadership
description: Learn Servant Leadership in one minute.

hook.text: The CEO serves lunch in the cafeteria on Fridays. Not for showâ€”because she believes leaders serve first.

buildup.text: Servant leadership flips the hierarchy: the leader's job is to remove obstacles and help the team succeed.

discovery.text: Robert Greenleaf coined the term in 1970. The servant-leader serves first, then leads through that service.

twist.text: Critics say it can be too passive. In competitive environments, someone still needs to make tough calls fast.

climax.text: Companies like Southwest Airlines built empires on servant leadership. Service isn't weaknessâ€”it's strategy.

punchline.text: Lead by serving. The best leaders put their people first.
